doc.field: Account book of William Clarke Burdick (1829-1902), a cheese dealer from Allegany County, New York. The volume documents customer accounts from 1862 to 1865, and inventories of Burdick's assets from 1868-1876.

Account book of William Clarke Burdick (1829-1902), a cheese dealer from Allegany County, New York. The volume documents customer accounts from 1862 to 1865, and inventories of Burdick's assets from 1868-1876.

Account book kept by cheese merchant William Clarke Burdick (1829-1902), founder of the Allegany Cheese Company in Alfred, New York. Entries from 1862-1865 record the purchase and sale of cheese to customers in New York, Rhode Island and Pennsylvania. An index to customer names is included. Later entries list inventories of Burdick's assets from 1868-1876. Volume also contains four pages with cut-out images pasted on them, which obscures some writing.

William Clarke Burdick (1829-1902) was the son of Amos and Anstis Clarke Burdick, born in Alfred, Allegany County, New York on November 26, 1829. He founded the Allegany Cheese Company, a wholesale cheese distributor, in the mid-19th century. In 1886, the business was re-organized under the firm name of William. C. Burdick and Company. Burdick served as Alfred's town supervisor from 1874-1875, and was a trustee of Alfred University from 1857 until his death on January 28, 1902.
